metabolicpd package

Submodules

metabolicpd.life.network module

class metabolicpd.life.network.Metabolic_Graph(file: str | None = None, mass: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]] | None = None, flux: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]] | None = None, ffunc: Callable[[ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], int], float] | None = None, min_func: Callable[[ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]], int], float] | None = None, source_weights: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]] | None = None, t_0: float | int = 0, t: float | int = 10, num_samples: int = 50)

Bases: object

Implements the pipeline outlined in the associated paper.

network

A pandas dataframe containing the structure of the metabolic network.

mass

A list of positive floats of length equal to the number of metabolites in the network.

flux

A list of floats of length equal to the number of edges in the network

ffunc

A list of floats which take the y value of the desired function for the t values in t_eval. The sampled function must be differentiable and strictly increasing.

min_func

A function which decides the edge weight between actual (rather than virtual) metabolites.

source_weights

A list of floats which correspond to the weights of each source nodes (equivalently their edges).

t_0

Initial time value used when running simulation.

t

Final time value used when running simulation.

t_eval

A list of floating points in (t_0, t) used as sample points when fixing metabolite trajectories.

create_S_matrix(mass: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]])

Create the ‘S’ matrix, representing the dynamics for the network x’ = S(x) * f.

The form of the ‘S’ matrix comes follows LIFE dynamics, with edges in the network corresponding to columns in the matrix and metabolites in the network corresponding to the rows of the matrix.

Parameters:

mass – Numpy array of masses to construct the S matrix based off of.

Returns:

A numpy array representing the S matrix for the current metabolite masses.

fixMetabolite(mtb_name: str, val: float, trajectory: ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]] | Callable[[ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]]], ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]]] | None = None, isDerivative=False)

Sets fixed flag to true and mass value to init val, and gives a derivative function for the trajectory.

setInitialValue(mtb: str, val: float)

Sets mass value to vals.

simulate()

Runs the simulation.

metabolicpd.life.network.basic_plot(result: dict[str, list[float]], network: Metabolic_Graph, mtb_to_plot: list[int], ylim=[0, 3]) → None

Creates a plot showing the metabolites mtb_to_plot using Metabolic_Graph data.
